english: study; practice; learn; become familiar with

etymology.description: 羽(羽) (yǔ, "feather") + 白(白) (bái, "white") = imitation of the repeated action of birds flapping their wings -> to practice, study
etymology.interpretation: The character 習(習) (xí) draws on the image of birds practicing flight through repetitive flapping of wings, which parallels the concept of learning through practice and repetition in humans.
etymology.simplification: 習(習)→习(習): simplified by removing 羽(羽) (yǔ, "feather") details; represented by shorthand.

examples.chinese: 他习历史(他習歷史)，习诗词(習詩詞)。
examples.english: He studies history and practices poetry.

examples.chinese: 师傅让徒弟习武(師傅讓徒弟習武)，日渐精进(日漸精進)。
examples.pinyin: shīfù ràng túdì xí wǔ, rìjiàn jīngjìn
examples.english: The master has his apprentice practice martial arts, gradually improving.
